objects.name: FLAME Project
objects.description: Fraud Lifecycle Attack Map & Encyclopedia — open-source framework for structured fraud threat intelligence.

objects.name: Business Email Compromise — Vendor Impersonation Wire Fraud
objects.description: Threat actors compromise or spoof vendor email accounts, then impersonate the vendor to redirect legitimate invoice payments to actor-controlled accounts. BEC caused $2.9B+ in reported losses in 2023 ...

objects.name: Synthetic Identity — Credit Card Bust-Out
objects.description: Actors create fictitious identities by combining real SSNs (often belonging to children, elderly, deceased, or immigrants) with fabricated PII. They then "nurture" these synthetic identities over mont...

objects.name: Payroll Diversion via HR Portal Compromise
objects.description: Actors compromise employee self-service HR portals (Workday, ADP, UKG, etc.) to change direct deposit routing information, diverting paychecks to actor-controlled accounts. Often combined with email r...

objects.name: Insurance Premium Diversion via Agent Portal ATO

objects.name: Real Estate Wire Fraud — Closing Scam
objects.description: Actors compromise email accounts of real estate agents, title companies, attorneys, or mortgage lenders to monitor pending transactions and send fraudulent wire instructions to homebuyers at closing. ...

objects.name: Deepfake Voice Authorization for Wire Transfer
objects.description: Actors use AI-generated voice deepfakes to impersonate executives, clients, or authorized signers during phone-based wire transfer authorization. The first publicly documented case (2019) involved a U...

objects.name: SIM Swap to Cryptocurrency Exchange ATO

objects.name: Check Washing and Fraudulent Mobile Deposit

objects.name: Disability Insurance Fraud via Fabricated Medical Documentation
objects.description: Actors file fraudulent long-term or short-term disability claims using fabricated, exaggerated, or collusively obtained medical documentation. Schemes range from individual claimants exaggerating symp...

objects.name: Romance Scam to Money Mule Recruitment Pipeline

objects.name: Credential Stuffing to Loyalty Point / Gift Card Account Drain

objects.name: Insider-Enabled Account Fraud at Financial Institution
objects.description: Employees of financial institutions abuse their legitimate system access to commit or enable fraud — opening accounts with stolen identities, modifying customer records to facilitate unauthorized tran...

objects.name: Employment Fraud via Brand Impersonation
objects.description: Actors impersonate legitimate employers — particularly in healthcare staffing, home care, and remote work sectors — by registering lookalike domains and creating fake job postings. Victims are "hired"...

objects.name: First-Party Fraud (Bust-Out)
objects.description: First-party fraud occurs when an individual intentionally misrepresents their identity, intent, or financial situation to obtain credit or services with no intention of repayment. This threat path foc...

objects.name: Pig Butchering (Investment Scam)

objects.name: Deepfake Document Fraud

objects.name: Business Identity Theft
objects.description: Business Identity Theft (or Corporate Hijacking) involves threat actors impersonating a legitimate, functioning business — typically a small to medium-sized enterprise (SME) — to open financial accoun...

objects.name: Supply Chain Payment Fraud

objects.name: Mobile Banking Trojan / Overlay Attack
